Availability of general education courses outside of the owning Faculty may be restricted by the Program Authority, usually because they are closely related to the study area of the student’s program."}],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"GENC2100 - Global Finance","description":"


The General Education Course in Global Finance will equip students  with a broad understanding of global finance, current international financial developments and global financial risk management, so that they can apply this learning and understanding  in their future careers.


In the course, students will gain a practical understanding of factors contributing to foreign exchange rate risk, Asian capital markets, global tax management, global investment strategies and global financial risk management.  The course also provides analysis of multinational banks, investment banks and the funds management industry. Students will learn how companies can survive and expand their objectives in a global financial market that is subject to uncertainty. The course also provides analysis of multinational banks, investment banks and the funds management industry.

contentlets.keywords: general education - faculty of business,the hankbook
contentlets.description:
The General Education Course in Global Finance will equip students  with a broad understanding of global finance, current international financial developments and global financial risk management, so that they can apply this learning and understanding  in their future careers.

In the course, students will gain a practical understanding of factors contributing to foreign exchange rate risk, Asian capital markets, global tax management, global investment strategies and global financial risk management.  The course also provides analysis of multinational banks, investment banks and the funds management industry. Students will learn how companies can survive and expand their objectives in a global financial market that is subject to uncertainty. The course also provides analysis of multinational banks, investment banks and the funds management industry.
contentlets.title: Global Finance

Availability of general education courses outside of the owning Faculty may be restricted by the Program Authority, usually because they are closely related to the study area of the student’s program."}],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"GENC3004 - Personal Finance","description":"

The course introduces students from a non-financial background to the principles of accumulating, managing and protecting wealth. The course covers the topics of tracking expenses and preparing budgets, savings, buying on credit, securing a good job, buying a home, paying off mortgages faster, protecting yourself through using insurance, building wealth using superannuation, paying appropriate levels of tax and avoiding investment mistakes.

contentlets.description: The course introduces students from a non-financial background to the principles of accumulating, managing and protecting wealth. The course covers the topics of tracking expenses and preparing budgets, savings, buying on credit, securing a good job, buying a home, paying off mortgages faster, protecting yourself through using insurance, building wealth using superannuation, paying appropriate levels of tax and avoiding investment mistakes.

contentlets.keywords: general education - faculty of business,studying law and the taxation formula,income,captial gains,deductions,carrying on a business,preparing an income tax return,goods,tax avoidance and penalties,business entities,superannuation,tax for professionals
contentlets.description: Taxation affects all aspects of employment and business for graduates as they enter their profession. This course will provide students with an understanding of basic taxation issues, including superannuation and fringe benefits tax that will assist them in commencing employment.  The course will also introduce the basics of business taxation issues to assist the student who may choose to set up business as a self-employed contractor or professional.  The ethics of taxation and the role of the Australian Taxation Office will also be discussed.  On the completion of this course students should be able to manage simple taxation affairs personally, and know when to seek professional advice.
contentlets.title: Tax for Professionals
